data.text:
Movies reflect a person’s views on their surroundings. In addition to entertaining audiences, movies have the ability to teach and transform them. In fact, it provides a reprieve, a peek into a more promising future. Furthermore, it is a means of escaping and comforting our suffering.

Since the release of the first film, Joymoti, filmmaking in Assam has progressed at a quick pace. Jollywood is what the Assamese film industry is called. The Assamese film industry has also been recognized internationally at national awards and film festivals.

For certain young filmmakers who are not afraid to take risks, the Assamese film industry has come a long way. Obstacles have no power over these people. With their wonderful work, they have managed to captivate the Assam audience.

Let’s have a look at some of the best Assamese films on ReelDrama that no film buff should miss.

Ratnakar

Jatin Bora directed, produced, and starred in the action love film Ratnakar Assamese Movie. Ratnakar is the most successful Assamese film. It also stars Barsha Rani Bishya and Nishita Bora, two well-known Assamese actresses. Ashramika Saikia, a gifted young artist, is also featured in the film.

This Assamese film’s plot is simple, but it serves as a torchbearer for upcoming Assamese films. This film has served as a symbol or a sign for the revival of Jollywood (Assamese Film Industry).

After Adhinayak, Jatin Bora’s second directorial debut is Ratnakar Assamese Film. The film is reported to be based on the Tamil film Theri, which was released in 2016. This Assamese film tells the narrative of a single parent and his daughter. To hide his daughter from his past, he lives in a rural village with her. This film depicts a father and daughter’s love and lovely bond.

The chemistry between Ashramika Saikia, the Child Artist, and Jatin Bora, the lead actor, is something to watch in this film. Jatin Bora and Barsha Rani’s acting has set new standards for Jollywood.

Local Kung Fu

Local Kung Fu, Kenny Deori Basumatary’s directorial debut from 2013, has been named “India’s First Kung Fu Film.” The story revolves around an ordinary Guwahati lad named Charlie who is attempting to win over his Hindi-speaking girlfriend’s disapproving uncle. In addition to the plot of the film, there is a gang that is attempting to obtain a liquor license.

They must bribe the local excise inspector, who also happens to be Charlie’s Girlfriend’s Uncle, in order to obtain a license.

Furthermore, two fumbling amusing kids aspiring to be young ‘dons’ are depicted in the film. There’s a stolen laptop, a naked thief, and some poop jokes in between.

With his humorous action flick, Kenny Basumatary introduces an altogether new genre to Assam’s film industry. You can watch this movie over and over and still appreciate it every time. Although the film did not perform well at the box office, it was a hit with Assamese audiences. Local Kung Fu is regarded as one of the best Assamese comedies of the decade (2020).

Calendar

Himjyoti Talukder is the director of the film calendar, which is produced by Enajori Talkies. This film was released on February 16th, 2018. The film Calendar is a drama featuring Moloya Goswami, Arun Nath, Gunjan Bhardwaj, and Rimjhim Deka. The film received seven honors at the Prag Cine Awards North East 2018 in several categories.

Hitesh Kakati is a retired teacher who happily lives in a small village with his wife Manorama Kakati. Arunav, their newlywed son, lives in Delhi with his non-Assamese wife. Hitesh and Manorama Kakati adore their son and daughter-in-law, and they adore their parents as well. However, when Arunav returns home for Magh Bihu and tells Manorama about a big dilemma in his professional life, the situation gradually worsens. The journey of how the family deals with this dilemma keep the audience hooked to their seats!

Momtaaj

Momtaaj was directed by Pulak Gogoi and released in 2014. The film depicts the star-crossed lovers Momtaaj and Bedana in a story of intense love and heartbreak. The Assamese film has five songs and spans about two hours. Momtaaj also earned the director the Best Director Award at the first Filmfare Awards (East) 2013.

Kokaideu Bindass

Kokaideu Bindaas, directed by Dhruba Jyoti Bordoloi, depicts the lives of two brothers in an understated manner. Despite their differences, the two brothers embark on a road journey to learn more about each other and face their issues together. Gunjan Bhardwaj and Monuj Borkotoky play the two main characters. If you’re looking for a lighthearted laugh, this is the film for you.

Bornodi Bhotiai

Bornodi Bhotiai is a two-hour film that depicts the soul and true ambiance of Majuli, the world’s largest river island. Director Anupam Kaushik Borah uses magic realism to show that Majuli is more than Xattras. Bornodi Bhotiai took home the award for best film at the 2019 Sailadhar Baruah Memorial Film Awards.

Ekalavya

Ekalavya, the action/drama/romance was the first major Assamese film of 2022, was released on January 7 after great anticipation and curiosity. Ekalavya is a film directed by Alfred about two feuding brothers who are separated over their priorities. Kamal Lochan plays Abhay, a young man in love who, fearing rejection, is unable to gather the courage to ask Kavya, his ideal lady, out and instead privately dedicates poetry to her. In contrast, Kavya appears to be aware of Abhay’s affections for her, but she wants to wait for him to find the courage to ask her out. As the movie progresses, Abhay’s adopted brother takes advantage of this mistrust, setting in motion a tale of love, hatred, and envy, as well as a fatal night that changes everyone’s life. The Cast of Ekalavya includes Kamal Lochan Deka, Atana Mahanta, Roopchanda Sarma, Himanshu Gogoi, Karishma Puzari, Chinmoy Kataki, Mukut Nath, and more.

Local Utpaat

On May 13, 2022, the makers of the superhit Assamese film ‘Local Kung Fu’ released a new Assamese Comedy film titled ‘Local Utpaat.’ It was originally intended to be released on September 4, 2020, but was postponed owing to the COVID Pandemic. Local Utpaat is directed by Kenny Basumatary, one of Assam’s most outstanding filmmakers.

The Cast of Local Utpaat includes Bonny Deori, Poonam Gurung, Yatharth Agnihotri, Sarmistha Chakravorty, Montu, Deuri, and more.

Maya (played by Poonam) and Amit (played by Bonny/Yatharth) had been together for a long time. Amit works as a salesperson while also studying for government and banking career examinations and interviews. He has always lived with his flatmates. Maya has an older sister who is pressuring her to marry a wealthy man named Donnie. Amit is despised by Maya’s older sister.

Local Utpaat has earned more than the Ranveer Singh-starrer Jayeshbhai Jordaar and Dr. Strange in the first week.

Now that Assamese Cinema has finally entered the realm of OTT, Subscribe to ReelDrama and watch your favorite Assamese films already. There are still a number of mind-blowing Assamese movies that are yet to release this year. We can’t wait to continue the list for you.

So, hang in there!
